Cee_Cee_Chapman:
{{short description|American country music singer-songwriter|bot=PearBOT 5}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Cee Cee Chapman | image = | image_size = | birth_name = Melissa Carol Chapman | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1958|12|13}} | birth_place = [[Portsmouth, Virginia]] | instrument = Guitar | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 1988–1993 | label = [[Curb Records|Curb]], [[Capitol Records|Capitol]] | associated_acts = | website = }} '''Cee Cee Chapman''' (born '''Melissa Carol Chapman''' on December 13, 1958 in [[Portsmouth, Virginia]]{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc|page=89|year=2008|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}}) is an American [[country music]] singer-songwriter. Chapman was signed to [[Curb Records]].{{cite web|last=Brennan|first=Sandra|title=Cee Cee Chapman {{!}} Biography|url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=mn0000798601|pure_url=yes}}|work=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=September 12, 2014}} She charted five singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart. Chapman was nominated for Top New Female Vocalist at the 1988 [[Academy of Country Music Awards]].{{cite news|last1=Boehm|first1=Mike|title=K.T. Oslin Leads Country Pack With 5 Nominations|url=https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-1989-03-01-ca-658-story.html|access-date=September 12, 2014|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=March 1, 1989}} She was also nominated for Favorite Country New Artist at the [[American Music Awards of 1990]].{{cite news|title=Brown Gets 5 American Music Award Nominations|url=http://www.deseretnews.com/article/79094/BROWN-GETS-5-AMERICAN-MUSIC-AWARD-NOMINATIONS.html?pg=all|accessdate=September 12, 2014|work=[[Deseret News]]|date=December 29, 1989}} Jack Hurst of the ''[[Chicago Tribune]]'' gave Chapman's eponymous second album three stars out of four, calling her a "straight-ahead singer" who "attacks almost any kind of song here with obvious personal involvement that is often stunning."{{cite news|last1=Hurst|first1=Jack|title=Cee Cee Chapman Cee Cee Chapman (Curb/Capitol...|url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/1990-09-20/features/9003180837_1_star-reba-mcentire-straight-ahead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120208012841/http://articles.chicagotribune.com/1990-09-20/features/9003180837_1_star-reba-mcentire-straight-ahead|url-status=dead|archive-date=February 8, 2012|accessdate=September 12, 2014|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=September 20, 1990}} The album also received a favorable review from ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'', which stated that it was "characterized by intelligent song selection" and that Chapman "at times [sounds] like [[Cher]] gone down-home."{{cite news|title=Picks and Pans Review: Cee Cee Chapman|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20113491,00.html|accessdate=September 12, 2014|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=November 5, 1990}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- !
